content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can define a function `clean_column` to clean column names as follows:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # Lowercase the string
    str = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    str = strip(str)
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    str = replace(str, " " => "_")
    str = replace(str, "-" => "_")
    
    return str
end
```

This function takes a `String` as input and returns the cleaned column name. You can call this function on any string to clean it according to the specified rules. For example:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"
```

You can use this function in conjunction with other data processing functions or when working with tabular data where you want to ensure that column names are consistent and easier to work with programmatically.
